008 *******************************************************************************/
009package Ch04_Filters;
010import java.util.Random;
011
012import ij.ImagePlus;
013import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
014import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
015import imagingbook.common.image.OutOfBoundsStrategy;
016import imagingbook.common.image.access.ImageAccessor;
017
018/**
019 * <p>
020 * ImageJ plugin -- Jitter filter implemented with {@link ImageAccessor},
021 * allowing uniform access to all image types.
022 * Works for all image types, using nearest-border-pixel strategy.
023 * The input image is destructively modified.
024 * See Sec. 4.7 (Exercise 4.14) of [1] for additional details.
025 * </p>
026 * <p>
027 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic
028 * Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
029 * </p>
030 * 
031 * @author WB
032 * @version 2016/11/01
033 * @version 2022/09/23 added out-of-bounds strategy
034 * 
035 * @see ImageAccessor
036 * @see OutOfBoundsStrategy
037 */
038public class Jitter_Filter_ImageAccessor implements PlugInFilter {
039        
040        /** The filter radius. */
041        public static int R = 3;
042        /** The out-of-bounds strategy to be used (see {@link OutOfBoundsStrategy}). */
043        public static OutOfBoundsStrategy OBS = OutOfBoundsStrategy.NearestBorder;
044        
045        @Override
046        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
047                return DOES_ALL;
048        }
049
050        @Override
051        public void run(ImageProcessor ip1) {
052                final int w = ip1.getWidth();
053                final int h = ip1.getHeight();
054                final int d = 2 * R + 1;        // width/height of the "kernel"
055                
056                ImageProcessor ip2 = ip1.duplicate();
057                
058                ImageAccessor ia1 = ImageAccessor.create(ip1);
059                ImageAccessor ia2 = ImageAccessor.create(ip2, OBS, null);
060
061                Random rnd = new Random();
062                
063                for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
064                        for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
065                                int rx = rnd.nextInt(d) - R;
066                                int ry = rnd.nextInt(d) - R;
067                                // pick a random position inside the current support region
068                                float[] p = ia2.getPix(u + rx, v + ry);
069                                // replace the current center pixel in ip1
070                                ia1.setPix(u, v, p);
071                        }
072                }
073                
074                ia2 = null;
075                ip2 = null;
076        }
077        
078}
